ancestry->Human.description:
As unpredictable and varied as any of Golarion's peoples, humans have exceptional drive and the capacity to endure and expand. Though many civilizations thrived before humanity rose to prominence, humans have built some of the greatest and the most terrible societies throughout the course of history, and today they are the most populous people in the realms around the Inner Sea.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.7pU8yM7yPMw92SY3]{Human}

heritage->Dragonblood (Horned Dragon).name: Dragonblood (Horned Dragon)
heritage->Dragonblood (Horned Dragon).description: You're descended in some way from a dragon. Your physical features might show this outwardly, with a pair of draconic horns, patches of scaly skin, or even a tail, or you might develop an internal reserve of draconic power. You gain the dragonblood trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. Add Draconic to your ancestry's list of additional languages (allowing you to choose it as a language if your Intelligence modifier is positive). When you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. You can choose from dragonblood feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.

background->Warrior.name: Warrior
background->Warrior.description:
In your younger days, you waded into battle as a mercenary, a warrior defending a nomadic people, or a member of a militia or army. You might have wanted to break away from the regimented structure of these forces, or you could have always been as independent a warrior as you are now.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Strength or Constitution, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Intimidation skill and the Warfare Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.xQMz6eDgX75WX2ce]{Intimidating Glare} skill feat.

feat->Intimidating Glare.name: Intimidating Glare
feat->Intimidating Glare.description: You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} with a mere glare. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

class->Fighter.name: Fighter
class->Fighter.description:
Fighting for honor, greed, loyalty, or simply the thrill of battle, you are an undisputed master of weaponry and combat techniques. You combine your actions through clever combinations of opening moves, finishing strikes, and counterattacks whenever your foes are unwise enough to drop their guard. Whether you are a knight, mercenary, sharpshooter, or blade master, you have honed your martial skills into an art form and perform devastating critical attacks on your enemies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.kzxu2dI7tFxv6Ix6.JournalEntryPage.HZbrRRVzW7w17L2W]{Fighter}

feat->Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
feat->Reactive Strike.description: Ever watchful for weaknesses, you can quickly attack foes that leave an opening in their defenses. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KAVf7AmRnbCAHrkT]{Reactive Strike} reaction.

feat->Shield Block.name: Shield Block
feat->Shield Block.description: You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} general feat, a reaction that lets you reduce damage with your shield.

feat->Shield Block.name: Shield Block
feat->Shield Block.description:
Trigger While you have your shield raised, you would take physical damage (bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing) from an attack.

You snap your shield in place to ward off a blow. Your shield prevents you from taking an amount of damage up to the shield's Hardness. You and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.

action->Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
action->Reactive Strike.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

feat->Bravery.name: Bravery
feat->Bravery.description: Having faced countless foes and the chaos of battle, you have learned how to stand strong in the face of fear. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to expert. When you roll a success at a Will save against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

feat->Fighter Weapon Mastery (Pick).name: Fighter Weapon Mastery (Pick)
feat->Fighter Weapon Mastery (Pick).description: Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with your weapons of choice. Choose one weapon group. Your proficiency rank increases to master with the simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks in that group, and to expert with the advanced weapons in that group. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons and unarmed attacks for which you have master proficiency.

feat->Battlefield Surveyor.name: Battlefield Surveyor
feat->Battlefield Surveyor.description: Whether taking stock of an enemy army or simply standing guard, you excel at observing your foes. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master. In addition, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks for initiative, making you faster to react during combat.

feat->Weapon Specialization.name: Weapon Specialization
feat->Weapon Specialization.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

feat->Battle Hardened.name: Battle Hardened
feat->Battle Hardened.description: Your experience in battle helps protect you against magic and toxins alike. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

feat->Combat Flexibility.name: Combat Flexibility
feat->Combat Flexibility.description: You can prepare your tactics to suit different situations. When you make your daily preparations, you gain one fighter feat of 8th level or lower that you meet the prerequisites for and don't already have. You can use that feat until your next daily preparations.

feat->Dragon's Flight.name: Dragon's Flight
feat->Dragon's Flight.description:
Frequency once per round

You have grown a small pair of draconic wings or have honed your use of the wings you've had since birth. You Fly. If you don't normally have a fly Speed, you gain a fly Speed of 20 feet for this movement. If you aren't on solid ground at the end of this movement, you fall.

feat->True Dragon's Flight.name: True Dragon's Flight
feat->True Dragon's Flight.description: Your wings have grown more powerful, capable of keeping you aloft longer. You have a fly Speed of 20 feet at all times.

feat->Powerful Shove.name: Powerful Shove
feat->Powerful Shove.description:
You can push larger foes around with your attack. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.19OLlTrxvEtDAOHc]{Aggressive Block} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.gt9pvIicabSOe6pB]{Brutish Shove} against a creature up to two sizes larger than you.

When a creature you Shove or knock back with a shield, polearm, or club's critical specialization effect has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes @Damage[@actor.abilities.str.mod]{damage} equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1).

feat->Resounding Bravery.name: Resounding Bravery
feat->Resounding Bravery.description:
Even your fears serve as fuel for your fighting spirit. When you critically succeed at a Will save against a foe's ability, you gain a +1 status bonus to saves and a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute. These benefits are doubled if you critically succeed against a fear effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.NMmsJyeMTawpgLVR]{Effect: Resounding Bravery}

feat->Brutish Shove.name: Brutish Shove
feat->Brutish Shove.description:
Requirements You are wielding a two-handed melee weapon.

Using the momentum of your last attack to throw your weight into another, you make your opponent stumble back. Make a Strike with a two-handed melee weapon. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your current turn, and you can automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} it, with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect, if your Strike was a critical hit). If you move to follow the target, your movement doesn't trigger reactions.

This Strike has the following failure effect.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your current turn.

feat->Lunge.name: Lunge
feat->Lunge.description:
Requirements You are wielding a melee weapon.

You attack an enemy at the edge of your reach. Make a Strike with a melee weapon, increasing your reach by 5 feet for that Strike. If the weapon has the disarm, shove, or trip trait, you can use the corresponding action instead of a Strike.

feat->Vicious Swing.name: Vicious Swing
feat->Vicious Swing.description: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady. Make a melee Strike. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, you deal an extra die of weapon damage. If you're at least 10th level, increase this to two extra dice, and if you're at least 18th level, increase it to three extra dice.

feat->Toughness.name: Toughness
feat->Toughness.description: Your body can withstand more punishment than most before succumbing. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. You reduce the DC of recovery checks by 1.

feat->Titan Wrestler.name: Titan Wrestler
feat->Titan Wrestler.description: You can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} creatures up to two sizes larger than you, or up to three sizes larger than you if you're legendary in Athletics.

feat->Cat Fall.name: Cat Fall
feat->Cat Fall.description: Your catlike aerial acrobatics allow you to cushion your falls. Treat falls as 10 feet shorter. If you're an expert in Acrobatics, treat falls as 25 feet shorter and 50 feet if you're a master. If you're legendary in Acrobatics, you always land on your feet and don't take damage, regardless of the distance of the fall.

feat->Rapid Mantel.name: Rapid Mantel
feat->Rapid Mantel.description: You easily pull yourself onto ledges. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}, you can pull yourself onto that surface and stand. You can use Athletics instead of a Reflex save to Grab an Edge. If you Climb or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} to within 5 feet beneath the top of an edge, you can pull yourself onto the surface and stand as part of that action.

feat->Intimidating Prowess.name: Intimidating Prowess
feat->Intimidating Prowess.description: In situations where you can physically menace the target when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your Intimidation check and you ignore the penalty for not sharing a language. If your Strength modifier is +5 or higher and you are a master in Intimidation, this bonus increases to +2.

feat->Natural Ambition.name: Natural Ambition
feat->Natural Ambition.description: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field. You gain a 1st-level class feat for your class. You must meet the prerequisites, but you can select the feat later in the character creation process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.

feat->Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
feat->Sudden Charge.description: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing. Stride twice. If you end your movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, you can make a melee Strike against that enemy. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.qQt3CMrhLkUV1wCv]{Sudden Charge} while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat->Canny Acumen (Fortitude).name: Canny Acumen (Fortitude)
feat->Canny Acumen (Fortitude).description: Your avoidance or observation is beyond the ken of most in your profession. Choose Fortitude saves, Reflex saves, Will saves, or Perception. You become an expert in your choice. At 17th level, you become a master in your choice.

backpack->Backpack.name: Backpack
backpack->Backpack.description: A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items and the first 2 Bulk of these items don't count against your Bulk limits. If you're carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it on your back, its Bulk is light instead of negligible

consumable->Bravo's Brew (Moderate).name: Bravo's Brew (Moderate)
consumable->Bravo's Brew (Moderate).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves, or +3 when attempting Will saves against fear.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.eh7EqmDBDW30ShCu]{Effect: Bravo's Brew}

equipment->Daredevil Boots.name: Daredevil Boots
equipment->Daredevil Boots.description:
These brightly colored, soft-soled boots motivate you to perform risky stunts and grant you the agility to succeed. The boots grant you a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks and a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Tumble Through an enemy's space.

The boots can grip solid surfaces and help you avoid a fall, allowing you to use the Grab an Edge reaction even if your hands aren't free. You treat falls as 10 feet shorter or, if you have the Cat Fall feat, treat your proficiency rank in Acrobatics as one degree better to determine the benefits of that feat. If you have Cat Fall and are already legendary in Acrobatics, you can choose the speed of your fall, from 60 feet per round up to normal falling speed.

consumable->Elixir of Life (Moderate).name: Elixir of Life (Moderate)
consumable->Elixir of Life (Moderate).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(5d6+12)[healing]] Hit Points and gain +2 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lPRuIRbu0rHBkoKY]{Effect: Elixir of Life}

weapon->Greatpick.name: Greatpick
weapon->Greatpick.description: This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.

armor->Splint Mail.name: Splint Mail
armor->Splint Mail.description: This type of armor is chain mail reinforced with flexible, interlocking metal plates, typically located on the wearer's torso, upper arms, and legs. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]{Padded Armor} and a pair of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Ix2vicchE79d6Cl3]{gauntlets}.

consumable->Potency Crystal (Greater).name: Potency Crystal (Greater)
consumable->Potency Crystal (Greater).description:
Activate F (concentrate)

Trigger You make an attack with the affixed weapon, but you haven't rolled yet

This fluorite crystal glows with a strange phosphorescence. When you activate the crystal, the weapon becomes a +2 greater striking weapon on the Strike and until the end of this turn, gaining a +2 item bonus to the attack roll and increasing the damage to three weapon damage dice.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.R5ugeFK3MPwkbv0s]{Effect: Potency Crystal}

effect->Effect: Paizo Adjustment.name: Effect: Paizo Adjustment
effect->Effect: Paizo Adjustment.description: Bumps the fly speed to 20 to match values printed The Scourge of the Sheerleaf.

equipment->Demon Mask (Greater).name: Demon Mask (Greater)
equipment->Demon Mask (Greater).description:
This terrifying mask is crafted in the visage of a leering demon and grants a +2 item bonus to Intimidation checks.

Activate—Leering Mask 2 (manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect The mask casts a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} spell with a DC of 29.

heritage->Warden.name: Guardián
heritage->Warden.description:
Usted y los miembros de su familia son sobrevivientes y han aprendido a cuidarse. Elige uno de los siguientes beneficios y escríbelo en tu hoja de personaje.

  • Añade 4 a tus puntos de vida máximos.
  • Te conviertes en un experto en tiradas de salvación de Fortaleza.
  • Te entrenas con una armadura media.

0.text: Cuando obtienes un fallo crítico en una prueba de Religión para descifrar escritos de naturaleza religiosa o para recuperar conocimientos sobre los principios de las religiones, obtienes un fallo.

1.text: Cuando intentas recuperar el conocimiento sobre los principios de tu propia fe, si obtienes un fracaso, obtienes un éxito, y si obtienes un éxito, obtienes un éxito crítico.

armor->Chain Shirt.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPcM4Wt6KmWE2kGL]

Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

shield->Steel Shield.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

equipment->Healer's Toolkit.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.s1vB3HdXjMigYAnY]

This kit of bandages, herbs, and suturing tools is necessary for Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. If you wear your healer's toolkit, you can draw and replace it as part of the action that uses it.

action->Raise a Shield.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]

Requisitos Estás empuñando un escudo

Colocas tu escudo para protegerte. Cuando hayas levantado un escudo, obtendrás su bonificación a la CA por las circunstancias indicadas. Tu escudo permanece levantado hasta el comienzo de tu próximo turno.

feat->Deity (Sarenrae).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.DutW12WMFPHBoLTH]
Deidad (Sarenrae)

feat->Divine Font (Healing).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.gblTFUOgolqFS9v4]
Fuente divina (curación)

deity->Sarenrae.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.BNycwu3I21dTh4D9]

Once a powerful angel and empyreal lord, Sarenrae led the charge to imprison Rovagug. The Dawnflower seeks to redeem evil where possible, burn it away with the fire of the sun when it can't be redeemed, and restore those harmed by evil's machinations.

Edicts destroy the Spawn of Rovagug, protect allies, provide aid to the sick and wounded, seek and allow redemption

Anathema create undead, lie, deny a repentant creature an opportunity for redemption, fail to strike down evil

Areas of Concern healing, honesty, redemption, and the sun

Lavanna Saltspray.name: Spray de sal de lavanda
Lavanna Saltspray.appearance:
Lavanna no puede recordar un momento en el que no estuviera a bordo de un barco. Lavanna, vendida por sus amos chelaxianos a un capitán mercante a una edad muy temprana, pronto encontró la libertad en aguas abiertas, ascendiendo en las filas del Silver Dancer, el primer barco en el que sirvió como miembro de la tripulación. Una noche, durante una tormenta particularmente temible, Lavanna quedó atrapada en cubierta, pero en lugar de ser arrojada o arrastrada por la borda, la joven halfling encontró paz en los vientos arremolinados y sintió gracia en elolas punzantes bañándola. Esta fue la primera vez que escuchó la voz de Gozreh y descubrió que tenía sangre de ondina en las venas.

El entrenamiento de Lavanna fue todo menos tradicional. Aprendió lo que pudo sobre la fe de Gozreh en cada puerto de escala, mientras mantenía sus deberes a bordo del barco mercante. Con el tiempo, se volvió bastante exitosa y asumió el cargo de sanadora de Silver Dancer. Un año más tarde, sus habilidades se pusieron a prueba cuando unSe produjo un terrible incendio a bordo y el barco comenzó a hundirse. Fue sólo gracias a la habilidad de Lavanna que alguno de los miembros de la tripulación sobrevivió a esa catástrofe. Afortunadamente, su barco fue descubierto por el Brass Bird, un barco pirata de cierto renombre. El Capitán Renlock se apiadó de las pobres almas del Silver Dancer, se hizo cargo de ellos y los dejó en el puerto más cercano.

Lavanna decidió quedarse a bordo del Brass Bird, ayudando a ministrar a la tripulación y garantizar que el barco navegara conLa gracia de Gozreh. Aunque nunca tuvo mucho estómago para la piratería, Lavanna se dedicó a la vida a bordo del Bird y descubrió que tenía mucho en común con la variada tripulación. Todos marginados y vagabundos, se forjaron vidas según su propia elección. Por un tiempo, eso fue suficiente. El Brass Bird tuvo problemas cuando su tripulación abordó un pequeño barco mercante frente a la costa de Varisia. Después de tomar los objetos de valor del barco, el Capitán Renlock dejó ir a la tripulación. Sin embargo, una bruja varisia se ofendió por el robo y puso unamaldición sobre el Pájaro y su tripulación. Terribles tormentas acosaron al Bird y su tripulación. Ninguna cantidad de oraciones a Gozreh podría calmar los mares. Peor aún, la armada andorana se enteró del rastro del Bird y persiguió al barco en cada esquina.

Después de una batalla campal, el Capitán Renlock entregó el barco y la pequeña familia que Lavanna había llegado a apreciar quedó destrozada. Afortunadamente, la mediana pronto recuperó su libertad después de sólo unos meses en prisión. Dirigiéndose haciaAl llegar al puerto, se encontró con su antiguo capitán a quien ayudó a rescatar hace tantos años. No dos días después zarpó de nuevo, esta vez en el Silver Dancer II. Los últimos cinco años han sido mayoritariamente pacíficos y prósperos. Lavanna se ha vuelto cómoda y con esa comodidad ha llegado la duda. Si bien atender a la tripulación es un trabajo importante, a veces se pregunta si la comodidad y la rutina que disfruta a bordo del barco se alinean con los principios de su deidad.

Tales pensamientos tendránSin embargo, tendrá que esperar, ya que le ha llegado la noticia de que el Capitán Renlock ha fallecido en prisión. Curiosamente, la noticia la dio su curioso loro mecánico, Cawlo...

Metas Lavanna se encuentra en una encrucijada y debe decidir si abandonar o no su estilo de vida fácil. Su pasión por los viajes crece día a día y pronto podría abrumarla. Quiere desesperadamente volver a mar abierto para poder navegar en nuevos mares, conocer gente nueva y verlo todo.que la generosidad de Gozreh ha proporcionado.

Personalidad Lavanna está un poco estancada. Anhela el océano abierto, desafiar el mar y las tormentas, navegando hacia lo desconocido para ver toda la generosidad de la naturaleza. Desafortunadamente, años de trabajo en un barco mercante la han vuelto suave y complaciente. La tripulación del Silver Dancer II tiende a ir a lo seguro, permaneciendo en la orilla durante condiciones climáticas peligrosas y viajando por rutas prohibidas. Aunque Lavanna consideraAunque es importante atender a la tripulación, a menudo se aburre por la falta de peligro en su rutina.

Lavanna también sigue fascinada por la naturaleza, pero en particular por el océano y las criaturas que lo habitan. A veces puede estar callada, pero cuando se trata de hablar sobre el mar, la mayoría descubre que no pueden decir una palabra entre sus frenéticos peroratas.

Relaciones Lavanna solía tener una racha un poco salvaje,sumergiéndose profundamente en el grog y cantando canciones marineras con el resto de la tripulación. Estos días se ha calmado hasta el punto de que la tripulación del Silver Dancer II la ve como un poco aburrida.

0.text: Cuando obtienes un éxito en una salvación contra un efecto de frío o agua, obtienes un éxito crítico.

feat->Additional Lore (Sailing Lore).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]

0.label: Control de la respiración (frente a inhalación)

1.text: Si obtienes un éxito en una tirada de salvación contra una amenaza inhalada, obtendrás un éxito crítico.

Rayo de debilitamiento

La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]

spell->Searing Light.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE]
Luz abrasadora

equipment->Religious Symbol of Gozreh (S.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.upzjwQ96cZG0Xlmx]
Símbolo Religioso de Gozreh (Plata)
equipment->Religious Symbol of Gozreh (S.description:

consumable->Scroll of Augury (Level 2).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]
Pergamino de Augurio (Nivel 2)
consumable->Scroll of Augury (Level 2).consumableSpellDescription:
You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveals the GM's best guess among the following outcomes:

  • Weal The results will be good.
  • Woe The results will be bad.
  • Weal and Woe The results will be a mix of good and bad.
  • Nothing There won't be particularly good or bad results.

The GM rolls a secret @Check[type:flat|dc:6|traits:secret]. On a failure, the result is always "nothing." This makes it impossible to tell whether a "nothing" result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.
consumable->Scroll of Augury (Level 2).description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury}

Lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino requiere sostener el pergamino en una mano y activarlo con una actividad de Lanzar un hechizo usando el número normal de acciones para ese hechizo.

Para lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino, el hechizo debe aparecer en tu lista de hechizos. Como eres tú quien lanza el hechizo, usa tu tirada de ataque de hechizo ydeletrea DC. El hechizo también obtiene el rasgo apropiado para tu tradición (arcana, divina, oculta o primordial).

Todos los componentes materiales físicos y los costos se proporcionan cuando se crea un pergamino, por lo que no es necesario proporcionarlos al lanzar un hechizo a partir de un pergamino. Debes reemplazar cualquier componente material requerido para ese hechizo con un componente somático. Si el hechizo requiere un enfoque, debes tener ese enfoque para lanzar el hechizo desde un pergamino.

Nota: Para crear un pergamino o varita de un hechizo específico, arrastre el hechizo desde el compendio o navegador de compendio al inventario de un PC, NPC o actor de botín.

consumable->Wand of Sanctuary (Level 1).consumableSpellDescription:
You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

Critical Success Sanctuary ends.

Success The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

Failure The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

Critical Failure The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

consumable->Wand of Heal (Level 1).consumableSpellDescription:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

deity->Gozreh.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.swwwP7eVmlNuWTb7]

Gozreh, una entidad atemporal nacida del primer viento que agitó los vastos océanos, deambula por el mundo en el aire y los mares. Los marineros arrojan cajas de carga como ofrendas para evitar una tormenta fatal, con la esperanza de complacer al viento y las olas, aunque saben que es mucho más probable que esas súplicas pasen desapercibidas, ya que atraen la atención de su deidad. El temperamento de la deidad es voluble y su furia rápida,lanzando relámpagos y arrastrando a las aplastantes profundidades a aquellos que se atreven a contaminar el mundo natural. Gozreh es el mar que encapsula la tierra y el viento que mueve su superficie, los pájaros que surcan el cielo y las nubes que los protegen.

Edictos valorar, proteger y respetar la naturaleza en todas sus formas

Anatema traer la civilización para invadir lo salvaje, crear muertos vivientes, saquear áreas debelleza natural

Áreas de preocupación naturaleza, mar y clima

spell->Dancing Lights.description: Creas hasta cuatro luces flotantes, ninguna de las cuales está a más de 10 pies de distancia. Cada uno arroja luz como una antorcha. Cuando sostienes el hechizo, puedes mover cualquier cantidad de luces hasta 60 pies. Cada luz debe permanecer a 120 pies de usted y a 10 pies de todas las demás, o parpadeará.

spell->Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
spell->Produce Flame.description:
A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach.

On a success, you deal 2d4 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and @Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

Una piedra eón gris opaca ha perdido sus propiedades mágicas especiales, a veces como resultado del uso excesivo de una esfera de turmalina o una piedra eón elipsoide de color lavanda pálido. Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]

Necesitas herramientas de ladrón para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (de algunos tipos) usando la habilidad Robo. Las herramientas de los ladrones infiltrados añaden una bonificación de +1 por objeto a las pruebas para abrir cerraduras y desactivar dispositivos.

Si las herramientas de tus ladrones están rotas, puedes repararlas reemplazando las ganzúas con @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} apropiadas para tus herramientas; esto no requiereusando la acción Reparar. Si usas tus herramientas de ladrón, puedes sacarlas y reemplazarlas como parte de la acción que las usa.

consumable->Comprehension Elixir (Lesser.description: This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For the listed duration after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn't automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages-you still need to attempt a skill check to Decipher Writing. The duration is 1 minute.

action->Devise a Stratagem.description:
Frequency once per round

You assess a foe's weaknesses in combat and use them to formulate a plan of attack against your enemy. Choose a creature you can see, and roll a d20. If you Strike the chosen creature later this round, you must use the result of the roll you made to Devise a Stratagem for your Strike's attack roll instead of rolling. You make this substitution only for the first Strike you make against the creature this round, not any subsequent attacks.

When you make this substitution, you can also add your Intelligence modifier to your attack roll instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, provided your Strike uses an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, a ranged weapon (which must be agile or finesse if it's a melee weapon with the thrown trait) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TLQErnOpM9Luy7rL]{Sap}.

If you're aware that the creature you choose is the subject of a lead you're pursuing, you can use this ability as a free action.

action->Pursue a Lead.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

You spend 1 minute examining the details of one potential clue, designating the subject related to that clue as the target of your active investigation. This subject is typically a single creature, item, or small location (such as a room or corridor), but the GM might allow a different scope for your investigation. You don't need to know the identity, purpose, or nature of the subject, but you do need to be aware of its existence. For instance, finding a footprint is enough to investigate the creature that left it, and seeing a hasty sketch of an item or location can be enough to start your investigation of that subject.

Whenever you attempt a Perception or skill check to investigate a designated subject, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the check. The exact checks this applies to depend on the actions you use to investigate and are determined by the GM, but checks to investigate are typically Perception checks or skill checks that use Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma.

You can maintain two active investigations at a time. If you Pursue another Lead after that, the subject must be different from any of your current investigations (or rather, they must be different as far as you know), and you give up on a current subject of your choice. Once you've given up pursuit of a subject, you can't Pursue that Lead again until after the next time you make your daily preparations.

action->Clue In.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger Another creature attempts a check to investigate a lead you're pursuing

You share information with the triggering creature.

They gain a circumstance bonus to their check equal to your circumstance bonus to checks investigating your subject from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xTK2zsWFyxSJvYbX]{Pursue a Lead}. The GM can add any relevant traits to this reaction depending on the situation, such as auditory and linguistic if you're conveying information verbally.

consumable->Oil (1 pint).description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Du05UxCyCM0ZWH8z]

Puedes usar aceite para alimentar las linternas, pero también puedes prender fuego a medio litro de aceite y tirarlo. Primero debes gastar una acción de Interactuar preparando el aceite, luego lanzarlo con otra acción como ataque a distancia. Si golpeas, salpica a la criatura o en un solo cuadrado de 5 pies al que apuntas. Debes lograr un @Check[type:flat|dc:10] para que el aceite se encienda exitosamente cuando golpee. Si el aceite se enciende, el objetivo toma1d6 de daño por fuego.

action->Rage.description:
Requirements You aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigado} or raging.

You tap into your inner fury and begin raging. You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Constitution modifier. This frenzy lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies you can perceive, or until you fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}, whichever comes first. You can't voluntarily stop raging. While you are raging:

  • You deal 2 additional damage with melee weapons and unarmed attacks. This additional damage is halved if your weapon or unarmed attack is agile.
  • You take a -1 penalty to AC.
  • You can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} while raging.

After you stop raging, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from Rage, and you can't Rage again for 1 minute.

La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qCEOZ6109Yo34tRx]

Un libro de fórmulas contiene las fórmulas necesarias para fabricar elementos distintos del equipo común de este capítulo; los alquimistas suelen obtener uno gratis. Cada libro de fórmulas puede contener fórmulas para hasta 100 elementos diferentes. Las fórmulas también pueden aparecer en hojas de pergamino, tabletas y casi cualquier otro medio; No es necesario que los copie en un libro específico siempre que pueda tenerlos a mano parahacer referencia a ellos.

ancestry->Cat.name: Gato
ancestry->Cat.description:
Tu compañero es un felino grande, como un leopardo o un tigre.

Talla Pequeña

Cuerpo a cuerpo 1 mandíbulas (delicadeza), Daño 1d6 perforación

Cuerpo a cuerpo 1 garra (ágil, delicadeza), Daño 1d4 cortante

Fuerza +2, Dex +3, Con +1, Int -4, Wis +2, Cha +0

Puntos de vida 4

Habilidad Sigilo

Sentidos visión con poca luz, olfato (impreciso, 30 pies)

Velocidad 35 pies

Especial Tu gato inflige 1d4 de daño de precisión adicional contra objetivos desprevenidos.

Beneficio de apoyo Tu gato desequilibra a tus enemigos cuando creas una apertura. Hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno, tus Golpes que causan daño a una criatura que tu gato amenaza hacen que el objetivo sea @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} hasta el final de tu próximo turno.

Maniobra avanzada Salto del gato

action->Cat Support Benefit.name: Beneficio de soporte para gatos
action->Cat Support Benefit.description: Tu gato desequilibra a tus enemigos cuando creas una abertura. Hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno, tus Golpes que causan daño a una criatura dentro del alcance de tu gato hacen que el objetivo sea @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} hasta el final de tu siguiente turno.

Quizrel.name: cuestionario
Quizrel.appearance:
Quizrel nació con un hocico hendido, lo que la llevó a ser intimidada por otros kobolds cuando era joven. Aunque originalmente recurrió a figuras de autoridad en busca de ayuda, Quizrel descubrió por las malas que una sociedad que valoraba el orden y la conformidad por encima de todo lo demás a menudo hacía poco para ayudar a sus marginados; la mayoría de las veces, Quizrel se metería en tantos o más problemas por ser victimizada que los que sufrirían sus acosadores por victimizarla. Finalmente, Quizrel decidió probar unenfoque diferente. La siguiente vez que un grupo de kobolds la rodeó con malas intenciones, ella mordió al cabecilla justo en la nariz y se negó a soltarla. Quizrel también se metió en problemas por esto, pero el acoso cesó.

Sin embargo, esta lección aprendida con tanto esfuerzo nunca le sentó bien a Quizrel, y luchó por aceptarla por completo. Después de mucho examen de conciencia, llegó a dos conclusiones: primero, no era justo que otros kobolds marginados sufrieran como ella, yEn segundo lugar, a Quizrel no le gustaba meterse en problemas. Con este fin, se lanzó al estudio de las leyes, reglamentos y castigos de Warren. Encontró todas las lagunas que pudo utilizar para obligar a los otros kobolds a fallar a su favor cuando surgieron conflictos. Armado con el poder del conocimiento, Quizrel pudo conseguir un mejor trato para los kobold inadaptados, obteniendo una satisfacción engreída al manipular a las autoridades que la habían abandonado para que finalmente actuaran. Y cuando el enfoque legal fracasó, unUn martillo en la cara en un túnel oscuro hizo maravillas.

Las experiencias de Quizrel le han dado un desprecio casual por las reglas y la autoridad, a pesar de haber aprendido a utilizar ambas a su favor. Nada emociona más a Quizrel que hacer algo prohibido y salirse con la suya. Ella constantemente ignora los toques de queda y las zonas prohibidas, escabulléndose entre guardias y trampas para explorar áreas prohibidas del subsuelo de Absalom y posiblemente robar algunos tesoros.mientras ella está allí. Quizrel tiene la ambición de finalmente llegar a la superficie de Absalom, caminar entre la gente, las calles y los lujos de la ciudad, y luego regresar para contar la historia y llenar de asombro a sus compañeros kobolds.

heritage->Dragonscaled Kobold.name: Kobold escamado de dragón
heritage->Dragonscaled Kobold.description: Tus escamas son especialmente coloridas y poseen algo de la misma resistencia que posee un dragón. Obtienes una resistencia igual a la mitad de tu nivel (mínimo 1) al tipo de daño asociado con tu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.ancestryfeatures.Item.egpiSWBrNBb1Fmig]{Draconic Exemplar}. Duplica esta resistencia contra las armas de aliento de los dragones.

Rhin.name: Rin
Rhin.appearance:
Rhin pasó su juventud como carroñero, cavando entre los ladrillos desmoronados y la tierra compactada de la ciudad subterránea de Absalom en busca de cosas útiles. Un día, mientras excavaba los restos enterrados de una casa, Rhin logró recuperar un libro infantil prácticamente intacto. Intrigado por las coloridas imágenes, Rhin separó con cuidado las páginas para investigar su nuevo hallazgo. Aunque el libro estaba escrito en un idioma que él no entendía y la escritura estaba prácticamente arruinada, las ilustracionespintó una historia clara: Rhin quedó fascinado con la historia de un niño humano con un anillo mágico que emprendió atrevidas aventuras y podía llamar a un dragón del mar con una melodía especial.

Convencido de que se trataba de una especie de libro de historia, Rhin ha hecho todo lo posible para emular a este misterioso héroe.

Escatimó monedas y recogió retales de tela para coser un traje que hacía juego con el niño del cuento. Un anillo de cobre, deslustrado hasta volverse verde,adorna uno de sus dedos. De manera algo más práctica, Rhin se sometió a un curso intensivo de artes marciales, emulando las posturas y maniobras que realizaba el niño; si bien este no fue el mejor de los maestros, también demostró estar lejos de ser el peor. Sin embargo, lo más sorprendente para los otros kobolds Hookclaw fue la música de Rhin. Cada vez que Rhin toca un determinado conjunto de melodías, la magia parece responder.

Rhin cree firmemente que su poder proviene de unDragón dormido en el puerto de Absalom que escucha su ocarina en sus sueños y le envía su poder a cambio. Los otros Hookclaws se muestran escépticos, pero nadie puede contener la respiración el tiempo suficiente para demostrar que Rhin está equivocado. Sus canciones son claramente efectivas, y los siempre pragmáticos kobolds creen que es muy probable que sus poderes provengan de un dragón hundido. El propio Rhin está siempre buscando nueva música e inspiración, convencido de que si puede tocar la melodía correcta, su dragón despertará y se elevará hastareunirse con él.

ancestry->Elf.name: Elf
ancestry->Elf.description:
As an ancient people, elves have seen great change and have the perspective that can come only from watching the arc of history. After leaving the world in ancient times, they returned to a changed land, and they still struggle to reclaim their ancestral homes, most notably from terrible demons that have invaded parts of their lands. To some, the elves are objects of awe—graceful and beautiful, with immense talent and knowledge. Among themselves, however, the elves place far more importance on personal freedom than on living up to these ideals.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.3cfdiId1IoxLsF9V]{Elf}

heritage->Dragonblood (Conspirator Drago.name: Dragonblood (Conspirator Dragon)
heritage->Dragonblood (Conspirator Drago.description: You're descended in some way from a dragon. Your physical features might show this outwardly, with a pair of draconic horns, patches of scaly skin, or even a tail, or you might develop an internal reserve of draconic power. You gain the dragonblood trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. Add Draconic to your ancestry's list of additional languages (allowing you to choose it as a language if your Intelligence modifier is positive). When you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. You can choose from dragonblood feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.

background->Farmhand.name: Farmhand
background->Farmhand.description:
With a strong back and an understanding of seasonal cycles, you tilled the land and tended crops. Your farm could have been razed by invaders, you could have lost the family tying you to the land, or you might have simply tired of the drudgery, but at some point, you became an adventurer.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Constitution or Wisdom, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Athletics skill and the Farming Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.W6Gl9ePmItfDHji0]{Assurance} skill feat with Athletics.

feat->Assurance (Athletics).name: Assurance (Athletics)
feat->Assurance (Athletics).description:
Even in the worst circumstances, you can perform basic tasks. Choose a skill you're trained in. You can forgo rolling a skill check for that skill to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (do not apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, choose a different skill and gain the benefits for that skill.

class->Cleric.name: Cleric
class->Cleric.description:
Deities work their will upon the world in infinite ways, and you serve as one of their most stalwart mortal servants. Blessed with divine magic, you live the ideals of your faith, adorn yourself with the symbols of your church, and train diligently to wield your deity's favored weapon. Your spells might protect and heal your allies, or they might punish foes and enemies of your faith, as your deity wills. Yours is a life of devotion, spreading the teachings of your faith through both word and deed.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.kzxu2dI7tFxv6Ix6.JournalEntryPage.N4ABcd6CcCbqmw3x]{Cleric}

feat->Deity (Cleric) (Erastil).name: Deity (Cleric) (Erastil)
feat->Deity (Cleric) (Erastil).description:
As a cleric, you are a mortal servitor of a deity you revere above all others. Your deity grants you the trained proficiency rank in one skill and with the deity's favored weapon. If the favored weapon is uncommon, you also get access to that weapon.

Your deity also adds spells to your spell list. You can prepare these just like you can any spell on the divine spell list once you can prepare spells of their rank as a cleric. Any of these spells that aren't normally on the divine list are still divine spells if you prepare them this way.

Sanctification

Depending on your deity, their sanctification can make you holy or unholy. This gives you the holy or unholy trait, which commits you to one side of a struggle over the souls of the planes and may be referenced in other abilities. If you "can be" holy or unholy according to your deity, you make that choice, and if you "must be" holy or unholy you gain the trait automatically. If you gain the opposing trait in some way, you lose the previous trait until you complete an atone ritual.

Anathema

Acts fundamentally opposed to your deity's ideals are anathema to your faith. Learning or casting spells, committing acts, and using items that are anathema to your deity remove you from your deity's good graces.

Casting spells with the unholy trait is almost always anathema to deities who don't allow unholy sanctification, and casting holy spells is likewise anathema to those who don't allow holy sanctification. Similarly, casting spells that are anathema to the tenets or goals of your faith could interfere with your connection to your deity. For example, casting a spell to create undead would be anathema to Pharasma, the goddess of death. Many actions that are anathema don't appear in any deity's formal list. For borderline cases, you and your GM determine which acts are anathema.

If you perform enough acts that are anathema to your deity, you lose the magical abilities that come from your connection to your deity. The class features that you lose are determined by the GM, but they likely include your divine font and all cleric spellcasting. These abilities can be regained only if you repent by conducting an atone ritual.

feat->Doctrine.name: Doctrine
feat->Doctrine.description:
Even among followers of the same deity, approaches vary. At 1st level, you select cloistered cleric or warpriest and gain the benefits of its first doctrine. At 3rd level and every four levels thereafter, you gain another benefit from your doctrine.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.ZZzLMOUAtBVgV1DF]{Cloistered Cleric}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.0Aocw3igLwna9cjp]{Warpriest}

feat->First Doctrine.name: First Doctrine
feat->First Doctrine.description:
You gain the first benefit of your doctrine:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.aiwxBj5MjnafCMyn]{Cloistered Cleric}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.xxkszluN9icAiTO4]{Warpriest}

deity->Erastil.name: Erastil
deity->Erastil.description:
Erastil is an old deity. Originally an elk-headed god of the hunt, he changed long ago to his current purview of family, farming, and trade, yet still holds to a few of the ancient ways. Currently, Erastil's concerns lie with community and the work that sustains those communities. Farming serves the basic needs of a people and requires them to maintain the crops. Families are the most basic unit of a community, with one generation caring for another. Trade requires enough to serve other communities, thus creating bonds of familiarity and interdependence. Yet behind this idyllic image lies the hard, oaken core of primal woods and steaming skin. This gives Erastil a multifaceted history, and while worshippers near cities and newer settlements worship the "softer" image of Erastil (an old man of the worshipper's ancestry), people in the wilderness or from very old civilizations still have the elk-headed depictions in their homes.

Title Old Deadeye

Areas of Concern family, farming, hunting, trade

Edicts care for your home and family, fulfill your duties, keep the peace, protect the community

Anathema abandon your home in its time of need, choose yourself over your community, tarnish your reputation, tell lies

Religious Symbol bow and arrow

Sacred Animal stag

Sacred Colors brown, green

feat->Cloistered Cleric.name: Cloistered Cleric
feat->Cloistered Cleric.description:
You are a cleric of the cloth, focusing on divine magic and your connection to your deity's domains.

First Doctrine (1st): You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.hT4INKGtly4QY8KN]{Domain Initiate} cleric feat.

Second Doctrine (3rd): Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

Third Doctrine (7th): Your proficiency ranks for the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics increase to expert.

Fourth Doctrine (11th): You gain expert proficiency with your deity's favored weapon, simple weapons, and unarmed attacks. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using your deity's favored weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect; you can use your spell DC in place of your class DC.

Fifth Doctrine (15th): Your proficiency ranks for the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics increase to master.

Final Doctrine (19th): Your proficiency ranks for the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics increase to legendary.

feat->Domain Initiate (Family).name: Domain Initiate (Family)
feat->Domain Initiate (Family).description:
Your deity bestows a special spell related to their powers. Select one domain—a subject of particular interest to you within your religion—from your deity's list. You gain an initial domain spell for that domain, a spell unique to the domain and not available to other clerics.

Domain spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to pray to your deity or do service toward their causes.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and can't be cast using spell slots. Your focus pool can hold one Focus Point for each focus spell you have, up to 3 points.

Special You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different domain each time and gaining its domain spell.

feat->Cleric Spellcasting.name: Cleric Spellcasting
feat->Cleric Spellcasting.description:
Your deity bestows on you the power to cast divine spells. You are a spellcaster, and you can cast spells of the divine tradition using the Cast a Spell activity. As a cleric, your chants generally invoke your deity and their powerful servants by name or title, while your gestures are followed by sacred symbols or other representations of your deity.

At 1st level, you can prepare two 1st-rank spells and five cantrips each morning from the common spells on the divine spell list or from other divine spells to which you gain access and learn via Learn a Spell. Prepared spells remain available to you until you cast them or until you prepare your spells again. The number of spells you can prepare each day is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as a cleric, the number of spells you can prepare each day increases, as does the highest rank of spell you can cast, as shown in Cleric Spells per Day table above.

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack to see how effective they are or for your enemies to roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Since your key attribute is Wisdom, your spell attack modifier and spell DC use your Wisdom modifier.

Heightening Spells

When you get spell slots of 2nd rank and higher, you can fill those slots with stronger versions of lower-rank spells. This increases the spell's rank, heightening it to match the spell slot. Many spells have specific improvements when they are heightened to certain ranks.

Cantrips

Some of your spells are cantrips. A cantrip is a special type of spell that doesn't use spell slots. You can cast a cantrip at will, any number of times per day. A cantrip is always automatically heightened to half your level rounded up—this is usually equal to the highest rank of cleric spell slot you have. For example, as a 1st-level cleric, your cantrips are 1st-rank spells, and as a 5th-level cleric, your cantrips are 3rd-rank spells.

feat->Divine Font (Healing).name: Divine Font (Healing)
feat->Divine Font (Healing).description:
Through your deity's blessing, you gain additional spells that channel either the life force called vitality or its counterforce, the void. When you prepare your spells each day, you can prepare additional @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} spells, depending on your deity. The divine font spell your deity provides is listed in the Divine Font entry for your deity; if both are listed, you can choose between heal or harm. Once you choose, you can't change your choice short of divine intervention.

Healing Font: You gain 4 additional spell slots each day at your highest rank of cleric spell slots. You can prepare only heal spells in these slots. At 5th level, the number of additional slots increases to 5, and at 15th level, the total number of additional slots increases to 6.

Harmful Font: You gain 4 additional spell slots each day at your highest rank of cleric spell slots. You can prepare only harm spells in these slots. At 5th level, the number of additional slots increases to 5, and at 15th level, the total number of additional slots increases to 6.

feat->Second Doctrine.name: Second Doctrine
feat->Second Doctrine.description:
You gain the second benefit of your doctrine:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.sa7BWfnyCswAvBVa]{Cloistered Cleric}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.D34mPo29r1J3DPaX]{Warpriest}

feat->Third Doctrine.name: Third Doctrine
feat->Third Doctrine.description:
You gain the third benefit of your doctrine:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.s8WEmc4GGZSHSC7q]{Cloistered Cleric}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.Zp81uTBItG1xlH4O]{Warpriest}

feat->Second Doctrine (Cloistered Cleric.name: Second Doctrine (Cloistered Cleric)
feat->Second Doctrine (Cloistered Cleric.description: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

feat->Third Doctrine (Cloistered Cleric).name: Third Doctrine (Cloistered Cleric)
feat->Third Doctrine (Cloistered Cleric).description: Your proficiency ranks for the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics increase to expert.

feat->Perception Expertise.name: Perception Expertise
feat->Perception Expertise.description: You remain alert to threats around you. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to expert.

feat->Resolute Faith.name: Resolute Faith
feat->Resolute Faith.description: Belief provides a bulwark against insidious thoughts. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

consumable->Bravo's Brew (Moderate).name: Bravo's Brew (Moderate)
consumable->Bravo's Brew (Moderate).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves, or +3 when attempting Will saves against fear.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.eh7EqmDBDW30ShCu]{Effect: Bravo's Brew}

consumable->Elixir of Life (Moderate).name: Elixir of Life (Moderate)
consumable->Elixir of Life (Moderate).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain @Damage[(5d6+12)[healing]] Hit Points and gain +2 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.lPRuIRbu0rHBkoKY]{Effect: Elixir of Life}

consumable->Explosive Ammunition.name: Explosive Ammunition
consumable->Explosive Ammunition.description:
Ammunition any

Activate A (manipulate)

This piece of ammunition is coated in gritty black soot. When activated explosive ammunition hits a target, the missile explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (including the target). Each creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save.

weapon->Longbow.name: Longbow
weapon->Longbow.description: This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can't be used while mounted.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

consumable->Spellstrike Ammunition (Type.name: Spellstrike Ammunition (Type IV) (Divine Wrath)
consumable->Spellstrike Ammunition (Type.description:
Ammunition any

Activate 2 Cast a Spell

Mystic patterns create a magic reservoir within this ammunition. You activate spellstrike ammunition by Casting a Spell into the ammunition. The spell must be of a spell rank the ammunition can hold, and the spell must be able to target a creature other than the caster. A creature hit by activated spellstrike ammunition is targeted by the spell. If the creature isn't a valid target for the spell, the spell is lost.

The ammunition affects only the target hit, even if the spell would normally affect more than one target. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, use the result of your ranged attack roll with the ammunition to determine the degree of success of the spell. If the spell requires a saving throw, the target attempts the save against your spell DC.

The maximum rank of spell the ammunition can hold determines its item level and Price.

Maximum Spell Rank 4th

equipment->Symbol of Conflict (Greater).name: Symbol of Conflict (Greater)
equipment->Symbol of Conflict (Greater).description:
This tarnished necklace can be attuned only by someone who is holy or unholy. When you attune it, it transforms into your deity's religious symbol or a personal symbol if you don't have a deity. You receive a +2 item bonus to Religion and a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against holy and unholy effects.

Activate—Presence 2 (concentrate, manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Effect The symbol casts 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XSujb7EsSwKl19Uu]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hVU9msO9yGkxKZ3J]{Divine Wrath}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction}.

The counteract DC of these effects is 27, and the counteract modifier is +17.

Craft Requirements You must be holy or unholy.

equipment->Traveler's Chair.name: Traveler's Chair
equipment->Traveler's Chair.description: A traveler's chair is tailored for frequent adventures and travels. The design is sleek and fashionable to provide excellent comfort and support. A traveler's chair has small mechanisms, either made from interlocking wood pieces, clockwork, or other devices, that allow the chair to traverse up or down stairs without any additional difficulty (moving up stairs is still difficult terrain, just like for other characters), and move through other common adventuring terrain without any additional difficulty, such as ladders and uneven ground.

equipment->Wand of Widening (4th-Rank Sp.name: Wand of Widening (4th-Rank Spell)
equipment->Wand of Widening (4th-Rank Sp.description:
The end of this wand is forked with a peridot setting.

Activate Cast a Spell; The activation takes 2 if the spell normally takes 1 to cast, or 3 if the spell normally take 2

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell, and increase its area. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet; add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller; or add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate rank. The spell must have a casting time of 1 or 2, can't have a duration, and must have an area of burst (10 feet or more), cone, or line.

weapon->Wheel Blades.name: Wheel Blades
weapon->Wheel Blades.description: A set of large blades have been attached to your chair's wheels. While in the chair, you gain a wheel blade Strike. Your wheel blade deals 1d4 slashing damage and has the agile, attached, and free-hand traits. A wheel blade is a simple melee weapon in the sword weapon group. You can etch weapon runes onto wheel blades. A wheelchair can only have one attached weapon.

feat->Draconic Aspect (Claw).name: Draconic Aspect (Claw)
feat->Draconic Aspect (Claw).description:
You have an obvious draconic feature, such as sharp claws, a snout full of sharp teeth, or strong reptilian tail, that you can use offensively. You gain your choice of one of the following unarmed attacks. The attack is in the brawling group and has the listed damage die and traits.

  • Claw 1d4 slashing (agile, finesse, unarmed)
  • Jaws 1d6 piercing (forceful, unarmed)
  • Tail 1d6 bludgeoning (sweep, trip, unarmed)

Special You can select this feat only at 1st level, and you can't retrain into or out of this feat, nor can you change the type of attack you gained.

feat->Deadly Aspect.name: Deadly Aspect
feat->Deadly Aspect.description: You have honed the unarmed attack your draconic heritage has granted you to a lethal degree. The unarmed attack you gained from Draconic Aspect gains the deadly d8 trait.

feat->Elf Step.name: Elf Step
feat->Elf Step.description: You move in a graceful dance, and even your steps are broad. You Step 5 feet twice.

feat->Healing Hands.name: Healing Hands
feat->Healing Hands.description: Your vitality is even more vibrant and restorative. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}, you roll d10s instead of d8s.

feat->Magic Hands.name: Magic Hands
feat->Magic Hands.description: The blessing of your deity heightens your healing ability, integrating magical healing with the mundane. When you succeed at a Medicine check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}, you can roll d10s instead of d8s for the healing and add a status bonus to the healing equal to your level.

feat->Toughness.name: Toughness
feat->Toughness.description: Your body can withstand more punishment than most before succumbing. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. You reduce the DC of recovery checks by 1.

feat->Advanced First Aid.name: Advanced First Aid
feat->Advanced First Aid.description: You use your medical training to ameliorate sickness or assuage fears. When you use Medicine to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, instead of Stabilizing a character or Stopping Bleeding, you can reduce an ally's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition by 2, or remove either of those conditions entirely on a critical success. You can remove only one condition at a time. The DC for the Medicine check is usually the DC of the effect that caused the condition.

feat->Cat Fall.name: Cat Fall
feat->Cat Fall.description: Your catlike aerial acrobatics allow you to cushion your falls. Treat falls as 10 feet shorter. If you're an expert in Acrobatics, treat falls as 25 feet shorter and 50 feet if you're a master. If you're legendary in Acrobatics, you always land on your feet and don't take damage, regardless of the distance of the fall.

feat->Continual Recovery.name: Continual Recovery
feat->Continual Recovery.description: You zealously monitor a patient's progress to administer treatment faster. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}, your patient becomes immune for only 10 minutes instead of 1 hour. This applies only to your Treat Wounds activities, not any other the patient receives.

feat->Robust Recovery.name: Robust Recovery
feat->Robust Recovery.description: You learned folk medicine to help recover from diseases and poison, and using it diligently has made you especially resilient. When you Treat a Disease or a Poison, or someone else uses one of these actions on you, increase the circumstance bonus granted on a success to +4, and if the result of the patient's saving throw is a success, the patient gets a critical success.

feat->Ward Medic.name: Ward Medic
feat->Ward Medic.description: You've studied in large medical wards, treating several patients at once and tending to all their needs. When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}, you can treat up to two targets. If you're a master in Medicine, you can treat up to four targets, and if you're legendary, you can treat up to eight targets.

feat->Battle Medicine.name: Battle Medicine
feat->Battle Medicine.description:
Requirements You're holding or wearing a healer's toolkit.

You can patch up wounds, even in combat. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC as for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} and restore the corresponding amount of HP; this doesn't remove the wounded condition. As with Treat Wounds, you can attempt checks against higher DCs if you have the minimum proficiency rank. The target is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2XEYQNZTCGpdkyR6]{immune} to your Battle Medicine for 1 day. This does not make them immune to, or otherwise count as, Treat Wounds.

feat->Heroic Recovery.name: Heroic Recovery
feat->Heroic Recovery.description:
The restorative power of your healing invigorates the recipient. If the next action you use is to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} targeting a single living creature and the target regains Hit Points from the spell, the target also gains three bonuses until the end of its next turn: a +5-foot status bonus to its Speed, a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, and a +1 status bonus to damage rolls. In addition, if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, it can immediately Stand as a free action that doesn't trigger reactions.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.7ogytOgDmh4h2g5d]{Effect: Heroic Recovery}

feat->Tail Whip.name: Tail Whip
feat->Tail Whip.description: By birth or through training, your tail is strong enough to make for a powerful melee weapon. You gain a tail unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has the sweep trait.

feat->Vision Of Weakness.name: Vision Of Weakness
feat->Vision Of Weakness.description: You can call upon divine insights to single out your foes' weak points. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NhNKzq1DvFxkvTEc]{Vision of Weakness} revelation spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Luces danzantes
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Creas hasta cuatro luces flotantes, ninguna de las cuales está a más de 10 pies de distancia. Cada uno arroja luz como una antorcha. Cuando sostienes el hechizo, puedes mover cualquier cantidad de luces hasta 60 pies. Cada luz debe permanecer a 120 pies de usted y a 10 pies de todas las demás, o parpadeará.

spell->Light.target: 1 objeto de 1 volumen o menos, ya sea desatendido o poseído por ti o por un aliado dispuesto

The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Staff of Healing.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.3OkOKxCee9WruGU5]

Hecho de madera blanca y lisa, este bastón está rematado en cada extremo con una cruz dorada adornada con una multitud de cabujones de rubí. Un bastón de curación otorga una bonificación de elemento a los puntos de vida que restauras cada vez que lanzas el hechizo de curación usando tus propios espacios de hechizo o usando cargas del bastón.

Activar Lanzar un hechizo

Efecto Gastas una cantidad de cargas del bastón para lanzar un hechizo de su lista.

Requisitos de artesanía Proporcionar un lanzamiento de todos los niveles enumerados de todos los hechizos enumerados.

La bonificación de objeto otorgada a curar hechizos es +1.

  • Truco @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnjhtQYexDtNDdEg]{Stabilize}
  • 1º @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

equipment->Bracers of Missile Deflection.description:

Estos brazaletes están hechos de placas de plata duradera y brillan como el sol de verano.

Activar R Interactuar

Frecuencia una vez al día

Desencadenante Un ataque con arma a distancia te golpea pero no es crítico

Requisitos Estás consciente del ataque y no estás desprevenido

Efecto Los brazaletes desvían el misil de su curso. Obtienes un bono de circunstancia +2 a la CA contra el ataque desencadenante. Si esto causa que el ataque falle, el ataque no te alcanzará.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.PeiuJ951kkBPTCSM]{Effect: Bracers of Missile Deflection}

consumable->Barkskin Potion.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zC7LipQPHRYw2RXx]

Después de beber este trago amargo, tu piel se espesa como una corteza. Obtienes los efectos de un hechizo de segundo rango @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YWrfKetOqDwVFut7]{Oaken Resilience} durante 10 minutos.

1.text: Si obtienes un éxito en una tirada de salvación contra una amenaza inhalada, obtendrás un éxito crítico.

Simeek.name: simeek
Simeek.appearance:
Simeek no es muy valiente. Durante años, los Hookclaws se desesperaron por encontrarle un trabajo dentro de la tribu, a pesar de su increíble fuerza. Los comandantes de la milicia expulsaron a Simeek después de que éste incumpliera constantemente las instrucciones más básicas. La etapa de Simeek como reparador de trampas terminó cuando estaba demasiado nervioso para aprender a usar una ballesta sin causar accidentes. Al final, el desventurado kobold terminó como un simple trabajador, con la tarea nada más compleja que mover cajas pesadas de un lugar a otro.otro. Y, sin embargo, esta simple decisión terminaría cambiando drásticamente el curso de la historia de la tribu Hookclaw. Cuando un aventurero sediento de sangre demostró ser demasiado hábil para las trampas de los kobolds e irrumpió en la madriguera, Simeek estaba trabajando en la zona. Por una vez, el kobold reaccionó audazmente en su pánico y golpeó al aventurero con un barril hasta que el intruso huyó.

Ahora Simeek es un héroe para la tribu, al menos, razonan los otros kobolds, hasta que algo inevitablemente suceda.se lo come. Sin embargo, los Hookclaws descubrieron que les gustaba tener un héroe y han invertido mucho trabajo para que Simeek esté a la altura del título. Simeek ha quedado encantado con los regalos inesperados de ropa y armaduras, que le permiten parecerse a los brillantes caballeros que admiraba cuando eran crías (habiendo malinterpretado de manera crucial el sentido de los cuentos de caballeros y dragones, especialmente entre los kobolds). Por supuesto, Simeek todavía está completamente desesperado, por lo que los Hookclaws se han asegurado de que varios otros kobolds permanezcan allí.con él en todo momento para asegurarse de que no se congele y lo maten.

El propio Simeek simplemente está feliz de que ahora les guste a los otros kobolds y acepta alegremente todo lo que le dicen. Ha sobrevivido a su cambio de profesión principalmente gracias a la suerte, pero en ocasiones, cuando entra en pánico en la dirección correcta, vuelve a hacer honor a su título de héroe. Ha demostrado ser demasiado ajeno para engañar y demasiado inocente para corromper, lo que lleva a los Hookclaw a la desesperación, pero también ha demostradoDespertó una cierta cantidad de orgullo posesivo. Después de todo, Simeek tiene un corazón de oro metafórico... que es lo más parecido al oro real que la mayoría de los Hookclaws han encontrado jamás.

0.text: Cuando escalas piedra natural, te mueves a la mitad de tu velocidad si tienes éxito y a toda velocidad si tienes éxito crítico.

1.text: Cuando obtienes un éxito en Squeeze, obtienes un éxito crítico.
