ancestry->Kobold.name: Kobold
ancestry->Kobold.description:
Every kobold instinctively understands the importance of power, and many are inclined to venerate those who have it, whether they be mighty dragons, cruel fiends, imperious fey, or even ancient artifacts. Kobolds seek out these alliances out of a sense of pragmatism—after all, who would dare bully a kobold who serves an ancient dragon?—but also because kobold eggs incubated near such loci of power take on physical traits (and sometimes abilities) similar to those of the warren's benefactor. On their own, kobolds are ingenious crafters and devoted allies, but outsiders who trespass into their territory find them to be inspired skirmishers and clever ambushers. However, these reptilian opportunists prove happy to cooperate with other humanoids when it's to their benefit, combining caution and cunning to make their fortunes in the wider world.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.naQrTTE7CXu5lnNt]{Kobold}

heritage->Dragonblood (Empyreal Dragon).name: Dragonblood (Empyreal Dragon)
heritage->Dragonblood (Empyreal Dragon).description: You're descended in some way from a dragon. Your physical features might show this outwardly, with a pair of draconic horns, patches of scaly skin, or even a tail, or you might develop an internal reserve of draconic power. You gain the dragonblood trait, in addition to the traits from your ancestry. Add Draconic to your ancestry's list of additional languages (allowing you to choose it as a language if your Intelligence modifier is positive). When you roll a success on a saving throw against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead. You can choose from dragonblood feats and feats from your ancestry whenever you gain an ancestry feat.

background->Prisoner.name: Prisoner
background->Prisoner.description:
You have been imprisoned or punished for crimes (whether you were guilty or not). Now that your sentence has ended or you've escaped, you take full advantage of the newfound freedom of your adventuring life.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Strength or Constitution, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the Stealth skill and the Underworld Lore skill. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.t3btih0O5RUwWynt]{Experienced Smuggler} skill feat.

feat->Experienced Smuggler.name: Experienced Smuggler
feat->Experienced Smuggler.description:
You often smuggle things past the authorities. When the GM rolls your Stealth check to see if a passive observer notices a small item you've @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, the GM uses the number rolled or 10—whichever is higher—as the result of your die roll, adding it to your Stealth modifier to determine your Stealth check result. If you're a master in Stealth, the GM uses the number rolled or 15, and if you're legendary in Stealth, you automatically succeed at hiding a small concealed item from passive observers. This provides no benefits when a creature attempts a Perception check while actively searching you for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} items.

PFS Note This feat allows you to Earn Income with Underworld Lore with tasks of your level -1 (instead of the normal level -2).

class->Rogue.name: Rogue
class->Rogue.description:
You are skilled and opportunistic. Using your sharp wits and quick reactions, you take advantage of your opponents' missteps and strike where it hurts most. You play a dangerous game, seeking thrills and testing your skills, and likely don't care much for any laws that happen to get in your way. While the path of every rogue is unique and riddled with danger, the one thing you all share in common is the breadth and depth of your skills.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.kzxu2dI7tFxv6Ix6.JournalEntryPage.u4qPrDRBagxG9wj8]{Rogue}

feat->Rogue's Racket.name: Rogue's Racket
feat->Rogue's Racket.description:
You've begun to develop your techniques and approach to a job, while building your reputation in rogues' circles. Choose a rogue's racket from the list below.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.D8qtAo2w4jsqjBrM]{Eldritch Trickster}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.RyOkmu0W9svavuAB]{Mastermind}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.3KPZ7svIO6kmmEKH]{Ruffian}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.ZvfxtUMtfIOLYHyg]{Scoundrel}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.wAh2riuFRzz0edPl]{Thief}

feat->Thief.name: Thief
feat->Thief.description:
Nothing beats the thrill of taking something that belongs to someone else. You might be a pickpocket working the streets, a cat burglar sneaking through windows, or even a consultant, testing your clients' vaults for openings.

When a fight breaks out, you prefer swift, lightweight weapons, and you strike where it hurts. When you attack with a finesse melee weapon or finesse melee unarmed attack, you can add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.

You are trained in Thievery.

feat->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
feat->Sneak Attack.description:
When your enemy can't properly defend itself, you take advantage to deal extra damage. If you Strike a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, a ranged weapon attack, or a ranged unarmed attack, you deal an extra 1d6 precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, that weapon must also be agile or finesse.

As your level increases, so does the number of damage dice for your sneak attack. Increase the number of dice by one at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

feat->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
feat->Surprise Attack.description: You spring into combat faster than foes can react. On the first round of combat, if you roll Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to you.

feat->Debilitating Strike.name: Debilitating Strike
feat->Debilitating Strike.description: When taking advantage of an opening, you both hinder and harm your foe. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bp0Up04x3dzGK5bB]{Debilitating Strike} free action.

action->Debilitating Strike.name: Debilitating Strike
action->Debilitating Strike.description:
Trigger Your Strike hits an off-guard creature and deals damage

You apply one of the following debilitations, which lasts until the end of your next turn:

  • Debilitation The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
  • Debilitation The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.yBTASi3FvnReAwHy]{Effect: Debilitating Strike}

feat->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
feat->Deny Advantage.description: As someone who takes advantage of openings, you are careful not to leave such gaps yourself. You aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

feat->Weapon Tricks.name: Weapon Tricks
feat->Weapon Tricks.description: You gain expert proficiency in simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks. When you critically succeed at an attack roll against an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature while using an agile or finesse weapon or an agile or finesse unarmed attack, you apply the critical specialization effect for that weapon or unarmed attack.

feat->Weapon Specialization.name: Weapon Specialization
feat->Weapon Specialization.description: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary.

feat->Perception Mastery.name: Perception Mastery
feat->Perception Mastery.description:
Barbarian Your instinct heightens each of your senses further. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Bard, Gunslinger, Rogue You've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Exemplar Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail, the better to watch over your wards and keep an eye out for monsters and other threats. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Ranger You have highly developed acuity and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

Swashbuckler Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

feat->Evasive Reflexes.name: Evasive Reflexes
feat->Evasive Reflexes.description: You've learned to move quickly to avoid explosions, dragons' breath, and worse. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

feat->Rogue Resilience.name: Rogue Resilience
feat->Rogue Resilience.description: Your physique is incredibly hardy. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

backpack->Backpack.name: Backpack
backpack->Backpack.description: A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items and the first 2 Bulk of these items don't count against your Bulk limits. If you're carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it on your back, its Bulk is light instead of negligible

equipment->Charlatan's Gloves (Greater).name: Charlatan's Gloves (Greater)
equipment->Charlatan's Gloves (Greater).description:
Tiny silver hooks decorate these fine silk gloves. They grant a +2 item bonus to Thievery and allow you to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand} as an innate occult spell.

If you are also wearing a charlatan's cape, whenever you would move an object using telekinetic hand, you may instead have it disappear in a puff of smoke and reappear hovering in a space adjacent to yours. This is a teleportation effect. The item hovers until the end of your turn or until retrieved with an Interact action.

consumable->Cheetah's Elixir (Greater).name: Cheetah's Elixir (Greater)
consumable->Cheetah's Elixir (Greater).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a +10 foot status bonus to your Speed for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.PeuUz7JaabCgl6Yh]{Effect: Cheetah's Elixir (Greater)}

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

weapon->Kukri.name: Kukri
weapon->Kukri.description: The blade of this foot-long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.

consumable->Oil of Repulsion.name: Oil of Repulsion
consumable->Oil of Repulsion.description:
Activate A (manipulate)

This oil contains magnetically charged iron filings repelled into opposite ends of the vial. For 1 minute after you apply this oil to armor, any creature that hits you with a melee Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed up to 10 feet away from you (the GM determines the direction).

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

consumable->Spider Root.name: Spider Root
consumable->Spider Root.description:
A paste made by mashing the fine, threadlike roots of a certain creeper vine, spider root renders a victim clumsy and maladroit.

Activate A (manipulate)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 6 minutes

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 minute)

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Vanishing Coin.name: Vanishing Coin
consumable->Vanishing Coin.description:
Activate F (concentrate)

Trigger You attempt a Stealth check for initiative, but you haven't rolled yet

Requirements You are trained in Stealth

This copper coin dangles from a leather strip strung through a hole drilled in the center. Until activated, the coin becomes invisible for a few seconds at random intervals every few minutes.

When you activate the coin, it casts a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell on you, lasting until the end of your next turn.

equipment->Winged Sandals.name: Winged Sandals
equipment->Winged Sandals.description:
Made from soft leather, with delicate white wings attached near the ankles, these sandals are ensorcelled with powerful air magic.

Whenever you fall while wearing these sandals, they automatically cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH]{Gentle Landing} on you. This benefit can't trigger again for 10 minutes.

Activate—Awaken Wings 2 (air, concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect The wings grow in size and propel you through the air, granting you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.1S51uIRb9bnZtpFU]{Effect: Winged Sandals}

feat->Ally's Shelter.name: Ally's Shelter
feat->Ally's Shelter.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You attempt a saving throw while adjacent to one or more allies, but you haven't rolled yet.

You follow your allies' example. Roll the save using an adjacent ally's modifier for that type of saving throw instead of your own.

feat->Scamper.name: Scamper
feat->Scamper.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to at least one enemy.

You Stride up to your Speed, with a +5-foot status bonus to your Speed, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. You must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

feat->Wing Buffet.name: Wing Buffet
feat->Wing Buffet.description:
You have a pair of draconic wings strong enough to batter your foes away and shove them away. Choose up to two creatures adjacent to you. Attempt an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check and compare it to the Fortitude DC of each target. This counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Critical Success The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to double your level (@Damage[2*@actor.level[bludgeoning]]) and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you.

Success The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your level (@Damage[@actor.level[bludgeoning]]) and is pushed up to 5 feet away from you.

Failure The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to half your level (@Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))[bludgeoning]]).

Critical Failure You fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} at the end of this activity.

feat->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
feat->Gang Up.description: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert. You can flank an enemy if it's within reach of both of you and an ally—you and your ally don't have to be on opposite sides. This benefits your allies as well as you, but only if they're flanking with you, not each other. The other requirements for flanking must still be met.

feat->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
feat->Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon.

You apply a contact poison or injury poison to the required weapon; if you have a free hand, you can Interact to draw a poison as part of this action. This poison can be one of the simple injury poisons you can create due to this feat, or another contact or injury poison you've acquired.

Special During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your level. These follow the rules for injury poisons, except that they deal @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage with no saving throw. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.

feat->Precise Debilitations.name: Precise Debilitations
feat->Precise Debilitations.description:
You attack with great precision. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bp0Up04x3dzGK5bB]{Debilitating Strike}.

  • Debilitation The target takes an additional 2d6 precision damage from your attacks. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.ZZXIUvZqqIxkMfYa]{Effect: Precise Debilitations}
  • Debilitation The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

feat->Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
feat->Unbalancing Blow.description: Interweaving attacks, you unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

feat->Fleet.name: Fleet
feat->Fleet.description: You move more quickly on foot. Your Speed increases by 5 feet.

feat->Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
feat->Swift Sneak.description: You can move your full Speed when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. You can use Swift Sneak while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat->Quick Jump.name: Quick Jump
feat->Quick Jump.description: You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} as a single action instead of 2 actions. If you do, you don't perform the initial Stride (nor do you fail if you don't Stride 10 feet).

feat->Wary Disarmament.name: Wary Disarmament
feat->Wary Disarmament.description: If you trigger a device or set off a trap while disarming it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC or saving throw against the device or trap. This applies only to attacks or effects triggered by your failed attempt, not to any later ones, such as additional attacks from a complex trap.

0.label: Wary Disarmament (vs. traps)

feat->Quiet Allies.name: Quiet Allies
feat->Quiet Allies.description: You're skilled at moving with a group. When you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoiding Notice} and your allies @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert}, you and those allies can roll a single Stealth check, using the lowest modifier, instead of rolling separately. This doesn't apply for initiative rolls.

feat->Rapid Mantel.name: Rapid Mantel
feat->Rapid Mantel.description: You easily pull yourself onto ledges. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge}, you can pull yourself onto that surface and stand. You can use Athletics instead of a Reflex save to Grab an Edge. If you Climb or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} to within 5 feet beneath the top of an edge, you can pull yourself onto the surface and stand as part of that action.

feat->Terrain Stalker (Rubble).name: Terrain Stalker (Rubble)
feat->Terrain Stalker (Rubble).description:
Select one type of difficult terrain from the following list: rubble, snow, or underbrush. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by all non-allies in that type of terrain, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} without attempting a Stealth check as long as you move no more than 5 feet and do not pass within 10 feet of an enemy during your movement.

During exploration, this also allows you to automatically approach within 15 feet of other creatures while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoiding their Notice}, as long as they aren't actively @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching} or on guard.

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, choose a different type of terrain.

feat->Foil Senses.name: Foil Senses
feat->Foil Senses.description: You are adept at foiling creatures' special senses and cautious enough to safeguard against them at all times. Whenever you use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions, you are always considered to be taking precautions against special senses.

feat->Intimidating Glare.name: Intimidating Glare
feat->Intimidating Glare.description: You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} with a mere glare. When you do, Demoralize loses the auditory trait and gains the visual trait, and you don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

feat->Quick Unlock.name: Quick Unlock
feat->Quick Unlock.description: You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick a Lock} using 1 action instead of 2.

feat->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
feat->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

Requirements You are not encumbered.

You deftly dodge out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

feat->Improved Poison Weapon.name: Improved Poison Weapon
feat->Improved Poison Weapon.description: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects. When you apply a simple poison with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ALbosSUygdq4T1Yk]{Poison Weapon}, the poison deals @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with Poison Weapon on a critically failed attack roll.

feat->Steady Balance.name: Steady Balance
feat->Steady Balance.description: You can keep your balance easily, even in adverse conditions. Whenever you roll a success using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} action, you get a critical success instead. You're not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attempting to Balance on narrow surfaces and uneven ground.

Takemiru.name: Takemiru
Takemiru.appearance:
La familia de Takemiru proviene del Bosque de los Espíritus al otro lado del mundo de Korvosa, pero viajó a Avistan a través del helado Camino de Aganhei como parte de una caravana de comerciantes con la esperanza de hacer fortuna a través del comercio. Sin embargo, a medida que crecía, Takemiru se dio cuenta de que los miembros de su familia no eran los amables comerciantes que se habían hecho pasar, sino que formaban parte de un grupo de bandidos que utilizaban el mercantilismo como tapadera para sus crímenes. Abandonó a su familia y se dirigió al sur, asumiendo una vida en solitario.de un cazador en la naturaleza que finalmente encuentra su camino hacia el interior de Korvosan y nuevos amigos. Después de pasar tanto tiempo solo en la naturaleza, le ha cogido mucho cariño a su nueva familia. Algún día espera traerlos de regreso a Tian Xia para mostrarles su tierra natal, pero todavía no tiene prisa por regresar.

Takemiru aparece como un humanoide musculoso parecido a un zorro con pelaje rojo y blanco y ojos azules brillantes. Su elección de armas sigue siendo un fastidio para quienes no lo conocen. Como elTridente de tres púas y sai que empuña, posee tres largas colas de zorro. El pelaje de cada cola se aclara hasta volverse blanco en la punta y, ocasionalmente, pequeñas volutas de humo flotan desde el pelaje en la punta de su cola central como si estuviera a punto de incendiarse.

0.label: Snare Crafting
Medicina Natural (Tratar Heridas con ingredientes frescos)

0.text: Si obtienes un éxito en una salvación de Fortaleza contra una posición o enfermedad en curso, reduce su etapa en 2, o en 1 si es virulenta. Si obtienes un éxito crítico, reduce su nivel en 3, o en 2 si es virulento.

feat->Additional Lore (Hunting).name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]
Conocimiento adicional (caza)

equipment->Everburning Torch.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.mRz8Jmk4Q06SsZpC]
Antorcha siempre ardiente
equipment->Everburning Torch.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.mRz8Jmk4Q06SsZpC]

Una antorcha siempre encendida es una de las aplicaciones más comunes de la magia permanente. Esta antorcha arroja luz constantemente, no requiere oxígeno y no genera calor. La llama se puede cubrir u ocultar, pero no se puede sofocar ni apagar.

equipment->Formula Book.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qCEOZ6109Yo34tRx]
Libro de fórmulas
equipment->Formula Book.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qCEOZ6109Yo34tRx]

Un libro de fórmulas contiene las fórmulas necesarias para fabricar elementos distintos del equipo común de este capítulo; los alquimistas suelen obtener uno gratis. Cada libro de fórmulas puede contener fórmulas para hasta 100 elementos diferentes. Las fórmulas también pueden aparecer en hojas de pergamino, tabletas y casi cualquier otro medio; No es necesario que los copie en un libro específico siempre que pueda tenerlos a mano parahacer referencia a ellos.

consumable->Biting Snare.description:
The snare's jaws shut on the leg of a creature that steps on it. The snare deals 5d6 piercing damage to the first creature that enters its square; that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed until it recovers at least 1 Hit Point.

consumable->Trip Snare.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SWqzv0hYCIczICeR]

You set a cunning wire to trip a creature. A Medium or smaller creature that enters this snare's square must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

If you want to create a trip snare to trip a larger creature, you must create a group of contiguous snares of a length equal to the edge of that larger creature's space, and the creature must be moving such that it moves into the full set of snares. For example, three trip snares in a 15-foot-line can trip a Huge creature coming down a corridor into the line of snares.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is off-guard until the start of its next turn.

Failure The creature falls prone.

Critical Failure The creature falls prone and takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

ancestry->Kitsune.name: Kitsune
ancestry->Kitsune.description:
Kitsune are a charismatic and witty people with a connection to the spiritual that grants them many magical abilities, chiefly the power to shapechange into other forms. Whether they pass unseen among other peoples or hold their tails high, kitsune are clever observers of the societies around them.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.45SK8rdbbxvEHfMn.JournalEntryPage.26YL1jOPQQS6k7A9]{Kitsune}

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description: You return to your natural shape or adopt a new shape as described in the feature that grants this action.

heritage->Earthly Wilds Kitsune.name: Earthly Wilds Kitsune
heritage->Earthly Wilds Kitsune.description: You are a creature of the material world, with an affinity closer to the wilds than urban society. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the finesse and unarmed traits. Your alternate form is a fox, which has the statistics of 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form}.

0.label: Constructed (vs. disease, poisons, death effects, paralysis, drained, and sickened)

consumable->Scroll of Force Barrage (Ran.name: Scroll of Force Barrage (Rank 1)
consumable->Scroll of Force Barrage (Ran.consumableSpellDescription:
You fire a shard of solidified magic toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of shards you shoot by one, to a maximum of three shards for 3 actions. You choose the target for each shard individually. If you shoot more than one shard at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

Heightened (+2) You fire one additional shard with each action you spend.
consumable->Scroll of Force Barrage (Ran.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.RjuupS9xyXDLgyIr]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

The spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack modifier and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when casting from a scroll. If the spell requires a locus, you must have that locus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).description:
Activate A (manipulate)

A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r 1d8[healing]]]{1d8 Hit Points}.

effect->Effect: Paizo Adjustment.name: Effect: Paizo Adjustment
effect->Effect: Paizo Adjustment.description: Adds a +1 Untyped Bonus to Crafting per the Tin Wizard's Crafting Checks.

action->Damage Avoidance: Reflex.name: Damage Avoidance: Reflex
action->Damage Avoidance: Reflex.description: It takes no damage when it succeeds at Reflex saves; this doesn't prevent effects other than damage.

action->Manual Dexterity.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.cT5octWchU4gjrhP]

Puede utilizar hasta dos de sus extremidades como si fueran manos para realizar acciones de manipulación.

action->Plant Form.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.57b8u8s3fV0UCrgJ]

Tu familiar planta puede cambiar de forma con una sola acción, transformándose en una planta diminuta de un tipo más o menos similar a la naturaleza del familiar. De lo contrario, esto utiliza los efectos de forma de árbol . Debes estar familiarizado con el rasgo de la planta, como un leshy, para seleccionar esta habilidad.

deity->Tlehar.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.0R2BjVb7d9tYCIbk]

The old gods of the threefold sun were all but forgotten under the rule of Walkena, the child god. But Tlehar never despaired, for the dawn must forever represent hope to all good people who gaze upon it. She holds the Bright Lions of Mzali especially dear in her heart, since they were a ray of hope to her people even when she couldn't be. Thanks to them, citizens of Mzali and beyond have been reminded of her loving embrace, and once again awaken with resolve in their hearts.

Tlehar keeps watch over every birth and new beginning, as there is no greater symbol of hope than new life. Midwives and nurses pray to Tlehar to keep watch over their work and ensure the health of newborns. Those coming to terms with a new gender or sexuality may call on Tlehar's blessing and protection as they learn to better understand themselves. People fleeing from unsafe homes can seek out her followers for safe refuge; these followers of Tlehar wear discrete, iron charms to let others know that they will be ready to fight for them. No matter their needs, Tlehar represents a sanctuary of peace in a sea of fear. It is her hope that the people of Mzali will soon live in fear no longer.

The dawn goddess is depicted as a human woman with golden skin, the gray-furred head of a lioness, and eyes as black as night. She is often portrayed on Chohar's left side, opposite her sister, with one hand extended in welcome and the other holding an iron morningstar. While Tlehar is not typically as strict in her justice as her counterparts, she shows no mercy to those who hurt the ones they claim to love. She may be willing to forgive those who offer sincere repentance, but the lioness of the dawn has a will of iron. She believes that sometimes, protecting the hope of a better tomorrow means destroying those who cast darkness over the future.

Edicts give yourself fully to everything you attempt, always maintain hope that tomorrow will be a better day, treasure every gift you are given by those who matter to you.

Anathema lose your motivation to your regrets, spread despair, treat a loved one poorly

Avatar

When casting the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ckUOoqOM7Kg7VqxB]{Avatar} spell, a worshipper of Tlehar gains the following additional abilities.

Tlehar Speed 50 feet, Fly speed 70 feet, cannot be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}

Melee 1 morningstar (versatile piercing, reach 15 feet), Damage @Damage[(6d6+6)[bludgeoning]]

Ranged 1 morning light (range increment 120 feet), Damage @Damage[(3d6+3)[fire],(3d6+3)[vitality]]

deity->Achaekek.description:
While Achaekek's divine genesis is heavily debated among scholars, it is believed that he was created-either by the power of a singular deity or a group of them-to eradicate those who would steal a god's divinity, and he has since become the enforcer of divine punishment. Known as He Who Walks in Blood, he slumbers in the blood of heretics and worshippers alike in an immense cleft carved into the base of the Boneyard's spire, a realm known as the Blood Vale. He keeps no formal relationships with any other deities, even his sister, Grandmother Spider, who repeatedly coaxes Achaekek to rebel against the gods and abandon his duties. In response, even though some gods disapprove of Achaekek's methods, few openly defy him.

Edicts conduct assassinations, spread the Red Mantis's infamy, wield sawtooth sabers in combat

Anathema kill a rightful ruler, become fixated on petty matters such as others' gender or ancestry, abandon an assassination contract you agreed to pursue

Areas of Concern assassins, divine punishments, and the Red Mantis

weapon->Spoon Gun.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MMYL2rfbYNWT0Rs1]

No one's entirely certain who developed the spoon gun, but all authorities agree that it was probably a goblin. Essentially a terrible idea in firearm form, the spoon gun is a spring-powered @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4LJEpZ2HkCu9BvHI]{Hand Cannon} with a modified grip that uses miscellaneous knives, forks, chopsticks, and spoons as ammunition. Users typically upend the entire contents of their cutlery drawer into the gun, aim it in the general direction of the foe, and hope it hits something.

This hand cannon is a martial weapon, instead of a simple weapon. It has the scatter (5 feet) trait and uses cutlery or similar-sized objects as ammunition instead of bullets (enough cheap cutlery to fire ten shots costs 1 sp).

A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach.

On a success, you deal 2d4 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and @Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

consumable->Scroll of Obscuring Mist (Le.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}

Lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino requiere sostener el pergamino en una mano y activarlo con una actividad de Lanzar un hechizo usando el número normal de acciones para ese hechizo.

Para lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino, el hechizo debe aparecer en tu lista de hechizos. Como eres tú quien lanza el hechizo, usa tu tirada de ataque de hechizo ydeletrea DC. El hechizo también obtiene el rasgo apropiado para tu tradición (arcana, divina, oculta o primordial).

Todos los componentes materiales físicos y los costos se proporcionan cuando se crea un pergamino, por lo que no es necesario proporcionarlos al lanzar un hechizo a partir de un pergamino. Debes reemplazar cualquier componente material requerido para ese hechizo con un componente somático. Si el hechizo requiere un enfoque, debes tener ese enfoque para lanzar el hechizo desde un pergamino.

Nota: Para crear un pergamino o varita de un hechizo específico, arrastre el hechizo desde el compendio o navegador de compendio al inventario de un PC, NPC o actor de botín.

Puedes lanzar un gancho de agarre con una cuerda atada para facilitar la escalada. Para anclar un gancho de agarre, haz una tirada de ataque con el rasgo secreto contra una CD dependiendo del objetivo, generalmente al menos CD 20. Si tienes éxito, tu gancho tiene un agarre firme, pero en caso de falla crítica, el gancho parece tenerlo. aguantará pero en realidad cae cuando estás medio arriba.

Zerryd.name: Zerryd
Zerryd.appearance:
Zerryd creció en el oeste de Cheliax, pero huyó recientemente después de una desastrosa incursión en su aldea por parte de cazadores chelaxianos. Después de establecerse en los destartalados barrios marginales de Old Korvosa, espera regresar algún día al sur, armado con el conocimiento y la experiencia para luchar contra los adoradores del diablo. Sin embargo, cuanto más viaja con sus nuevos amigos, más le conviene el estilo de vida de un aventurero. Está particularmente encantado de que aquí en Varisia haya poca evidencia de laEl odio que ha soportado por parte de los diabolistas chelaxianos, y aunque ha continuado sus estudios sobre la dependencia de esa nación de los demonios y el diabolismo con la esperanza de usar esta tradición contra los adoradores de Asmodeus, no tiene planes de regresar al sur en el corto plazo.

Zerryd tiene una apariencia imponente, considerando su estatura alta y ancha y la amplitud de sus alas. Tiene piel azul claro y cabello oscuro que combina con el color oscuro de sus alas de cuervo. Zerryd tiene un encantopersonalidad que le permite encontrar amigos fácilmente, un rasgo que le ha resultado muy útil cuando intenta tranquilizar a las personas que conoce.

feat->Nestling Fall.name: Nestling Fall
feat->Nestling Fall.description: You trust the strength of your wings and can spread them to glide safely to the ground. As long as you can act, you take no damage from falling, no matter what distance you fall.
